column9: text

The peppermill itself is a very nice facility. This trip. I had a bad experience with the staff. If was our anniversary, and my boss sent us champagne and strawberry's. They delivered it to us, and then called later and said don't open it...wth? They mistakenly gave us too expensive of a bottle and picked up that bottle and gave us a different bottle. We had to wait for them and they made us late to our dinner reservation. The difference in the bottle price was very minimal. Such a weird experience. The dinner at the steakhouse was very good..props to them! The maid walked into our room without knocking and we were like do you need something? She said it was a mistake? Again a very awkward situation. Upon checkout I discovered that the Bellman had dropped my makeup case, and broke it and several items in it. I called and they basically said there was no footage so I am SOL :/ Very disappointed. We have been guests before and did have a very good experience.

Just had dinner here with our 3 kids. The food was very good and kids meals were very reasonably priced ($7 for meal plus drink). The view was fantastic and great service too. Our server, Sarah, was very attentive and friendly and sweet!  We had a great time. The view is fantastic in the "golden hour" before sunset. Great restaurant for the whole family and a nice change of pace from eating quick serve meals on the beach.
Been here twice and both times consistently good.  Friendly staff, fresh sushi, and presented with flair and care.  Will come back.
Worst IHOP I've been to. Service and food is awful. I love IHOP but will never return to this location

This was our 1st time here. Won't be the last. Great food and service! Something different than the usual fare. Great appetizers and solid main course. Mofungo was so perfect! Definitely want to say great job to our waiters!
                                                                                                            Can't wait to get back and try some other taste treats!
                                                                                                            Do it!!!

Can't remember the name of what I had but it had "pig" in the name. Purely delicious! It had a very tasty chipolte sauce in it, which added that extra punch. One thing I really liked, was how it was served. Cut in half and in cups! Very neat and didn't get messy.

Overall it's a good place to go. The buildings are neat and creepy. Some of the rooms in the haunted house smell terrible. The actors are pretty good but not the best I've seen. To me it's very pricey for what you get. The lines for the first 2 attractions went fairly quick but the third line took about 2 hours to get through and it wasn't even halfway full only about 2 rows of the 8 rows they have setup. I probably wouldn't go back. It's one of those one and done type of places.
Very limited selection. The size of the store reminds me of the little grocery store in vacation towns. Unforntunely I have to go to another store to finish my shoping.

Once again a terrible $34.00 car wash. First of all $34.00 for a car wash is outrageous.  Wheel rims still dirty and vehicle not fully dried and water spots plus debris still on paint.  Ask for a rag to finish their poor job.  Spoke to some young punk who said he was the manager.  In stead of asking what could be done to make the situation right all I got was SORRY. Well SORRY is exactly the type of car wash you get. Misters has cornered the market in Tucson and obviously they just don"t give a S!!T.

Our family enjoys the Sunday brunch here. They easily accommodate many large groups and have a beautiful presentation. The variety of food is cooked well. On regular Sundays the cost is $25 pp & for $5 more add endless mimosas. On holidays like Mother's Day it's $40pp & they only give 1 mimosa pp complimentary. They offer so much variety it's difficult to try something from every area from kid friendly sliders & mac n cheese, to oysters on the half shell, shrimp & prime rib. The Resort is an old building elegantly decorated and reminiscent of old Safety Harbor rich with history. I personally appreciate that you pay the cashiers before entering into the brunch area. No waiting for the check when you're ready to leave. I never felt pressure & was able to enjoy the brunch & atmosphere.

This place is awesome - it has a fun sporty, relaxed atmosphere with a variety of food and drink options.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            The signature sauce on the wings is excellent (A+) and has just a tiny bit of a kick to it. Our service is consistently fantastic (friendly & quick) and there are a number of televisions in the facility for watching sports, etc. It seems like an excellent place to come and watch futbol (and they have some good breakfast offerings on 'Soccer Saturdays & Sundays'). They post information on that and on their upcoming beer tappings on their website.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Metered parking available on Mass. Ave. and there are a number of streets in the area with open parking. You can enter off Mass. Ave. or from another door off of the bike trail behind the pub.
Servers are either really inattentive or either really understaffed. Food is average at best. Just your basic bar food. Dont eat the chicken kabobs.

I would like to give you a higher score, Xochitl but you left me wanting... Halloween is my anniversary, and every year my partner and I try to go somewhere new every year to celebrate. This year I came across Xochitl's Dias de los Muertos four course $35 prixe fixe menu, and we decided to go!
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Sopas - My partner had the Pozole de Conejo (Rabbit) and I had the Caldo de Gallina y Masa (Chicken and Masa). They were good, but I did not have a single Masa dumpling in my soup... I was a little bummed.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Antojitos - My partner had the Gorditas Infladas con Frijoles y Queso Panela and I had the Escabeche de Guajalote. I was pleased with my dish, but my partner was not pleased with his.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Platos Fuertes - My partner had the Carne con Cileajo with blue masa tortillas, I had the Pescado Zapoteco with pumpkin seed mole! AMAZING! We both loved these dishes!
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Postres - My partner had the Crepas de Plantano Macho, and I had the Clafouti de Calabaza. Mine was so / so and my partner only had a taste of his... They were not that great.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            We were both uncomfortable, mostly because we were tucked away in a corner. The service was slow and our waiter did not seem like he was interested in being at work. We are definitely going to go back, but we are ordering from the main menu and we are making sure we have a different waiter / waitress.

By far one of the best things to do in St Louis if you are visiting or moving to the area! The best thing is that the tours are completely free! I have been multiple times and love going each time. The tours last about 45 mins to an hour and are very informative. The tour guide takes you through the entire brew process from start to finish and answers any questions you may have. The tour guide also gave little bits of history about the Budweiser company that I found very interesting.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            At the end of the tour you are given three free samples of anything they have on tap. In the tap room when I went they have lots of options to include Stella, Shocktop, ect.  in additional to your traditional Budlight. We even got to taste one of their new beers which was really cool.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            This year I even had the pleasure of going to the Budweiser Brewery Lights Experience. This was completely amazing and I highly recommend it to anyone who is in the area during the holiday season. The entire brewery is lit up with lights and Christmas themed decor. Throughout the brewery there are different activities for both adults and kids to keep everyone entertained. Upon arrival to the event you are given 5 tickets you can redeem for samples throughout the brewery. These samples included ciders, Stella, and a few other good beers as well. In addition to all this they also have bar food available such as brats, pretzels, chili all served fresh with plenty of seating inside the beer garden. Again, I highly recommend that everyone checks out this brewery!

great food. one of the best veggie burgers around! brunch on the patio is always great! and the paradise pie is in a category onto itself! amazingly delicious! great bartenders. friendly, attentive staff and management.

If you're in need of stunning bridesmaids dresses or any formal dress for that matter - look no further than Bella Bridesmaids! Lauren, Melanie and crew made the experience so fun and easy. The order process is also super simple. Can't thank them enough for helping me bring my special day to life!

My first time at Livery was tonight, I was with returning guest who raved about the "carriage house" margarita! Their cocktails alone deserve their own review as each of them are well thought out with each ingredient. The food was phenomenal and unique! Our server was Josh & I would return for his service alone as he is really knowledgeable about the menu and extremely friendly! I will be back for sure.

So my co-worker gets their prime rib special on Wednesday nights and one day (about 2 months ago) brought me one to-go so I could taste the magic for myself. I was impressed at how juicy and buttery it was so we made a date to go in person.  We were here two weeks ago on a Wednesday of course, and we were both disappointed in the quality of meat. I had asked for mine as rare as it could possibly be and my co-worker asked for it with the dry rub crusted on it. They came out very chewy and his was not crusted and mine was medium well. We both had two drinks and the bill came to $50 something. Not worth it in my opinion.

This place was an awesome find and where the locals go. The half shell oysters where delicious and strait from the sea fresh! The Alligator was well seasoned and tender along with the calamari. Where can you go to get a dozen of huge oysters for I think $5. Staff was attentive and nice. And the wait wasn't long at all. There's plenty of seats.

SO GOOD! My friend and I stopped in from out of town for breakfast. She had the Chicken biscuit with tomato gravy and I had the Miso bacon, egg biscuit. We are in heaven! We will definitely be back!!!

Free tour...which is pretty sweet. My husband and I are not Bud fans...but still like hearing the history of the Anheiser-Busch families.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Wear decent walking shoes as it is a 60 minute tour that consists of mainly walking. It was pretty warm today when we went on the tour. Some of the buildings did have A/C, but I was looking forward to being done. Free beer at the end of the tour which is great if you like the Bud brands. soda for the kids...which was luke-warm and a tad flat.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Worth stopping by if you have time to kill in STL. One that I would probably not go to all the time.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            BTW...if your GPS is unable to locate the actual location...here is the physical address of the brewery: 1127 Pestallozi St. & Lynch St, St Louis, Missouri.

My friends and I came here on a Friday night. It was busy but not crazy, we sat right away. The service was HORRIBLE. We were there for almost 3 hours. We had to ask the waiter multiple times for things we asked for, like drinks and bread (easy things). We all got apps and one of our friends apps didn't come out and we had to ask him twice for it. The food came out an hour after we ordered it. Bottom line is I will never come back again. The food was okay, but the service ruined my experience.

I was looking for a new salon when my former stylist moved away. I found A Salon and Spa through my best girl, Lindsay. A friend of her's from elementary school had recently started working here (Christy).
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            I must admit, I was quite nervous my first time in the chair here, only because my stylist was a recent graduate from cosmetology school.  Not to discount anyones's skills, of course. I'm generally nervous when anyone new cuts my hair; this just added to it
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Anyhow, Christy made sure she knew exactly what I wanted before she even got the scissors close to my head. She knew I was nervous so she made sure she had plenty of time to deal with my outrageousness.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Thank God for people with patience and awesome hair cutting skills!!! Christy is officially my one and only. She does a great job and is always willing to listen to what I want and provide feedback if needed.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            A Salon and Spa is located in a little strip mall. You wouldn't suspect that it's such an adorable space from the outside. The inside is decorated so well. It has a warm feeling about it and everyone is extremely friendly.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            To top it all off, A Salon and Spa carries excellent products and prices are great! $18 bucks for a haircut is a bargain.

The Good:
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            The ice is shaved fine, just like I like it.
                                                                                                            It's a convenient, Mid City location (close to my house).
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            The Bad:
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            They are painfully slow.  The line to order moved quickly, but once I placed my order, I was in for a 25 minute wait.
                                                                                                            I got the new butter pecan cream flavor, and also the Orchid Vanilla cream.  While they both had a good flavor to them, they tasted watered down.  They didn't have that creamy taste that most cream syrups have.
                                                                                                            I found them to be on the expensive side.  $4.75 for a medium snow ball with condensed milk is higher than most places.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            My favorite snoball stands are still Hansen's and Papa Sam's (Mandeville).

We screened a film here recently--in the Harold Prince Theater. The theater itself is a very good venue and the staff was friendly and helpful.
                                                                                                            But we were shocked that the projector that was used for our screening was so sub-par. It wasn't nearly bright/powerful enough to project in a space that size, so the film looked like it was shot completely at night. Some shots were so dark you couldn't see faces or detail at all. To think that we paid hundreds of dollars to use a crappy projector for a few hours...
                                                                                                            Given Penn's reputation as a top-notch institution (and Annenberg's, too) we really didn't think this sort of gaff was a possibility.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Lessons learned:
                                                                                                            1) If you are hosting an event here, go over every technical detail ahead of your event and don't make any assumptions about what is included.
                                                                                                            2) If you're going to a screening or presentation here don't assume that the quality will be good. And hopefully you won't think less of the filmmaker/presenter if the projection is shitty.
Went here for the first time about a month ago, I've been back about a dozen times since. Amazing food, amazing prices, great customer service, best water in town.

Very easy to find from the road. Service is slow. Extensive menu.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            After being seated, no one talked to us, and we didn't get our waters until we'd been sitting for 15 minutes. I hate how my mom is a stickler about water, but I guess it rubbed off on me. The waitstaff never came back with refills.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            The food was okay, not spectacular. The shrimp pad thai my friends ordered was spicy. I had the curry chicken. It was interesting. LOTS of sauteed onions with chicken and peanuts. (So many onions--I was overwhelmed.) The sauce wasn't spicy at all, and there wasn't a lot of it. I think I was expecting it to be more like an Indian curry, so my let down might be entirely my own fault.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            The bubble tea was good. They had a lot of flavors to choose from like jasmine, mango, and strawberry.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            2 rating because I was dissapointed by the service and the food. Waitstaff was nice, but wasn't efficient.

Egg white cups are fun! I get them often for breakfast but they're a bit unsatisfying and overly cheesy so I end up just wanting more food without feeling like I've eaten a good breakfast. I'm sad they stopped selling ancient grains oatmeal.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            I've gotten oatmeal from here a few times because it's right next to my first class of the day every day, but their toppings bar is rather limited and everything is sugared up and sweetened except the strawberries and almonds, and they often fill their oatmeal cups to the brim so it's hard to add a substantial amount of toppings.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Cosi bread is THE BEST. My friend and I used to come here just because their multigrains are so yummy (and their plains have the same oniony? but not oniony? flavored awesomeness that goes with every meal you could get). If you get a warm slice it totally makes your day.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Their turkey avocado sandwich is *very* filling! Great for togo lunches when you're powering through your day, but it still just tastes like fast food.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Service is consistently prompt, with on-and-off friendly cashiers. Some places you can walk into knowing you'll have really sweet service but here.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            High music volume + the types of food is too fast-foody for me to say it's a fantastic place to go if you have your choice of time constraints, but it's healthy enough for a good, quick lunch.
The best ever. Try the cardinal sin.

Bacchanal might be my favorite place in the whole world.  At least my favorite in all of New Orleans.  I've been in love with this fine neighborhood institution for 5 years, and the love just grows stronger.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            There is no other bar or restaurant I'd rather spend a evening at with my partner or friends.  The addition of the inside dining area has helped relieve the crowding issues they were starting to have.  But honestly, I don't mind sharing tables with other parties and I find that to be one of the charming features of this place.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Also, the new bartender can sling some amazing cocktails.  I know it's hard to go here and not order a bottle of wine, but if you're feeling something different, step over to the bar for a real treat.

Very good car wash with friendly service. I always thought not to bring my new AMG vehicle to machine using car wash because of scratch concerns but I gave it a try because I had a 1 month free coupon and MB fort washington actually recommends this car wash. I even saw S65 AMG (a quarter million dollar car) getting detailed here. Seriously no other car wash does better exterior job than this car wash. I honestly dont like how they take 9 dollars on interior vacuum because other carwashes just do it for free but it doesnt matter because I can vacuum myself for $1.50 I'll just call this a good sale stretegy. No one wants to vacuum 200 cars a day. I had that nightmare. (Im a former carwash employee) I unfortunately dont carry around cash and feel bit sorry for not paying tips but in return I actually get out of my car and dry wipe side sills myself lol.  Im planning to return to this car wash even after my free carwash expires.

You hear them say it all the time "We treat you like family." John went out of his way to make sure he did! I appreciated his efforts to ensure that I had a good experience regardless of whether I bought a car or not. I had a great experience and like not having to spend the entire that at the dealership! Looking forward to having my car delivered! I will add that picture when it happens.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Ken & John provided me 5 star service, but overall I'm giving the dealership 4 stars because in the end the other dealership had you beat on price and inventory. If I hadn't received 5 star service and John's willingness to match their price and my willingness to wait for inventory, I would have driven down the road and be in my car right now. Hope you appreciate that I am willing to wait for you guys to get me my car just to give you the business. It would be disappointing not to get my car on Monday.

I came to visit Armature Works in Tampa and happen to come across this place. I was thirsty, but  wanted to try out something different and fresh. I came upon this sangria they had promoting on their TV screen. Look delicious so I ordered one. Have to say, it was refreshing and delicious. Aside from the fact it was weekend and I wanted to unwind a bit, this came to be a good choice. I love the fact that fruits were included in the drink. Definitely recommend this drink if you are in the mood for something fresh and delicious.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            I also had their tostones rellenos. My favorite. Hemming's not only does their tostones good, but they do an awesome job in adding that pork meat, cilantro, and sauce. The flavor is outstanding. Keeping the Cuban tradition with a little added flavor. Recommended.

Never been to or heard anything about this place. Called & ordered flowers over the phone to be delivered for someone's birthday. Delivered as promised, in a vase, fresh and beautiful for a very reasonable price.

Standard beer and pub food fare. We tried four different beers: the mango IPA, the kolsch, the Brett Saison, and the Wit. We weren't impressed by any, but the Wit was our favorite out of the four. For food, we ordered corn fritters. The fritters were fine, but the sauce that came with them was a totally gross, fully congealed excuse for a queso. I held the tub of it upside down - nothing, it didn't drip. We were in the area and wanted to grab a beer, but I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to go back here!

Was recommended to me by a local. I really liked the Sonoran Hotdogs! I also hit the garbezo carmellos. It was so good the whole group went twice! Food was very reasonably priced and service was good! I would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Tucson.

I came here with my friends around the time closer to when it opened. I bought a $10 game card, but I didn't end up playing any games. I was planning on playing games after my friends finished their food, but the cooks obviously had different plans. We waited on food for two hours. Yes, you read that correctly. Two. Hours. When they got their food, it wasn't even hot. By then, I wasn't really in the mood to play games, and I was extremely grateful that I didn't order food myself. I would say that I would give it another try, but I heard there was no improvement so far with service. Since I still have my $10 game card, I would go just to strictly play the games only.
I tried their chicken taco special for the day today and they were really plain and no flavor at all. Took two bites and threw it. I wouldn't go to this place again.

Brought my son, Diego, here for a treat. It is excellent!  Stylish, hip, quality ingredients, and tastes yummy!  The flavors are original, and you can tell there was a lot of thought and care put into each one.
I yelped GAS STATIONS. This is just a WAWA store, they do not have a gas station or even a parking lot. Bad Yelp.

Ordered takeout less than an hour ago, go pick it up and get home. At first glance the buffalo chicken dip looks a little strange but it's a new place and everyone does things differently. NOPE! It tasted like straight oil! 3 bites in and I threw it in the trash. Caesar salad came with Italian dressing not Caesar, and the wings are so over cooked and lacking sauce. So disappointed. This used to be my go to place for wings, time to look elsewhere. Don't waste your time going here, spend the extra 10-15 minutes and get your food from a bar in Doylestown or the Pineville!

An exciting blend of Asian and Western cuisines, served in a stunning space featuring stone and glass, silk lanterns, arrangements of fresh orchids, and an impressive collection of Chinese art. Start with seafood wonton soup, a miso-like broth brimming with ginger-filled dumplings, or curried chicken ravioli with grilled eggplant. What seem to be odd combinations prove to be inventive, and delicious, creations - smoked duck with endive, spicy shrimp with sweet pear curry, sesame seed-encrusted halibut filet with crunchy French beans and tomatoes in a lemongrass sauce. Noodle dishes and stir-fries are impressive. One area where they really shine is one usually ignored by Asian eateries - dessert. Ginger creme with strawberries, hazelnut meringue with milk chocolate and champagne-poached kumquats, and fresh mango and blueberry cake are options that warrant serious consideration. As glamorous the decor and delectable the cuisine are, this loses a star for its far too small portions at much too high prices. Heaping more on the plate or lowering the tab probably would make this a more frequent destination instead of an occasional special event.

Almost a perfect experience. So close.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            BF and I had an impromptu date night, and I have been wanting to try Moto for a long time! We came in a bit late and were able to snag a nice booth at the front of the restaurant. I absolutely love the ambiance. It's modern and romantic, and they have a gigantic bar that is lovely.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            We ordered a bottle of wine, and I was pleased to see that they offer a variety of options to choose from with different price points. We got a delicious bottle of pinot for $36.00! Excellent.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            For entrees we got an order of wagyu beef meatball, and the prosciutto crostino
                                                                                                            with ricotta, thyme, honey. The crostino was amazing but the wagyu beef was a tad bit overcooked. Just a tiny bit.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Entrees were the blueberry lasagna and the black spaghetti. MMM. Both were outstanding. The blueberry lasagna is a must try if you like mushrooms, it's not sweet, definitely savory and rich. It was unlike anything I've had before and I loved it! I'd highly recommend the black spaghetti as well, it had lobster in the sauce and was out of this world!!
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Since it was date night, we decided to go for dessert and ordered the buttermilk gelato and the white peach mint sorbet. YUM. For only $3 a scoop, it was the perfect end to the meal.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            I am a big fan of Moto and will be back again to hopefully up my review to 5 stars!

Not good food. I thought this was I in china town it would be cheap. Ordered red snapper. Costed me more then 30 dollars plus there was no  meat in it. Over cooked burned fish for more then 30. I will never ever go there.

ONE word - Pancakes!!! They were made to perfection, as usual. Also, the hash brown casserole is always delicious. However, the portion size for the price is so disappointing. It's like this little dollop, such a tease :( But the pancakes always always, alwaysssss satisfy my hunger.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            The service was excellent, I expected such, being that this location is in the south - southern hospitality. For the first time I tried dessert and I didn't like it, at all. The peach cobbler and blackberry cobbler, two thumbs down. Other than that, everything else was superb!

Bicycle revolutions is my designated neighborhood bike shop. With a somewhat limited selection, and slightly higher prices, they're not my all time favorite. But, time after time, I find myself coming here because they're just so damn friendly and convenient. Brian is really great. I bought my first new bike (all the previous ones were hand me downs) here. At the time I didn't know much about what I was looking for. Brian helped me find a bike that fit correctly and was pretty much exactly what I was looking for.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Six months later, I've learned a lot more about bikes. I would avoid buying a complete bike again, and instead build one myself. And I'm sure that Bicycle Revolutions could help me do that. But all in all, they're a great shop, and are largely responsible for getting me into such a wonderful activity. Oh and I just bought my helmet here! Good selection and they helped me find one that fit. Get a helmet :)
Low key, offers more services than appears. Lots of stations and staff. Prices are good. Treated my 6 yo granddaughter like a princess. Super Friendly staff.

Bravo Ken, bravo! Each time I go to purchase a car I always look at the Cadillac, but when it comes time to make a decision I end up choosing another car. This is always a decision I end up with regretting in the long run. But finally we settled on a Cadillac, and Ken was very helpful. He made the buying experience enjoyable and comfortable for us. This was the best experience we had at a dealership to date. We went looking for the best deal on miles per gallon, and we came home with the best deal on smiles per gallon. Not only the vehicle, but the experience was worth every penny. I would recommend this vehicle, the dealership and Ken anyone, anytime.

Why can't you give a place 6 stars??
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            I walked in to Rodney Mitchell a little nervous.  I get my hair cut maybe twice a year, or when I notice the ends really drying out.  Last haircut I received was in February, and the girl (at a different salon) cut above brow bangs when I asked for her to angle my hair.  I remember my face turned beet red and my entire body broke out in a cold sweat.  Luckily, I loved the idea of bangs (even though they were poorly cut), but I was nervous to attempt it again.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Allison, one of Rodney Mitchell's hair dressers, eased all of my worries.  She and I immediately showed each other pictures of our pups, and talked about places to go out since I just moved into town a few months ago.  And that was just her personality.  Her skills as a hair stylist were just as wonderful.  She took her time on each section of my hair, asked me how I wanted my bangs handled, and even cut them little by little so I wouldn't have a repeat of my last hair cut.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            After she blow-dried my hair, she sat there and continued to perfect the haircut by walking around and fixing the "loose ends" so to speak.  She took such time and care with my hair, I felt like she knew me.  I walked out of there with the biggest smile on my face.  It was the best overall haircut experience I have ever had.  My hair bounced as I walked, but that could've been the haircut or the new bounce in my step due to my new found confidence.  I'd like to think it was both.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Some people reviewed this place to be pretentious or NYC meets CMT, but I'd beg to differ.  The decor on the walls is very earthy and casual.  And the tin wall hangings are really cool!  I thought the staff was friendly, helpful and efficient.  Nowhere did I see or hear a pretentious comment or anything remotely close to it.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            If you want fantastic care for your hair, this is your place.

My go-to donut shop. Best apple fritters, excellent long John's, perfect cake donuts. We go again and again. Just learned! You can call ahead and place your order and they'll hold it for you! Love this place.

One of our few encounters with perfection.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            To begin with, our daughter, the reason for this essay, is easy to please as long as things are done her way.  That is to say, she is somewhat idiosyncratic but simultaneously afraid of committing a faux-pas that would be devastating in the presence of her  friends but completely undetectable to us.  Her fiancé was equally challenging.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Not to worry as Rasa, Allegra, and Jenna were prepared for the challenge.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            The theme was bicycle-driven, the food was American Southern and, despite temperatures in the 90s, the party was a grand success.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            The Birchtrees  arranged for everything and delivered on time, with great skill, and displayed Solomonic wisdom during the planning and the doing.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Dinner for 50 was served at dusk under a tent in our (small) back yard, illuminated with tiny light bulbs suspended between fabric pennants.  The effect was magical.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            The setup took place on time and the cleanup went flawlessly.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            We have a bachelor son and look forward to a repeat experience, a although hopefully on someonelses's dime.
I'm going to give 5 stars. Drew and Tempest were excellent bartenders/servers and to top it off the food was great too. Will come back.
Visit New Orleans, try the local seafood. The restaurant is close to the airport. Oysters are really fresh and in good price. Half dozen oysters are just $5! Staffs are nice and friendly.

It pays to have friends who are chefs. Even better is marrying a chef who has chef friends, which I managed to do in March. Lucky us, one thoughtful chef friend gave us a gift card as a wedding gift to any of John Besh's restaurants, 3 of which are in New Orleans, where we honeymooned.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            We chose to go to Lüke, because it seemed the most "us". The restaurant is lovely inside, and feels intimate because there are several rooms, even though the space is quite large when you combine all the spaces. We were led back to the room near the kitchen, which might annoy some people, but for us, being able to look through a large plate glass window at the goings-on was added entertainment.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            I'll give you the rundown of what we ordered.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Charcuterie plate
                                                                                                            A symphony of pork, rabbit and other delicious things. Paté, head cheese, fois gras terrine, house-pickled watermelon rind and other pickles, stone ground mustard and plenty of toasts.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Crabmeat salad
                                                                                                            Mostly crab, served on greens, very lightly dressed. Sweetest crab I've ever eaten. Seriously.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Fried Oyster and bacon salad with buttermilk dressing
                                                                                                            Yes, there's lettuce, but the giant chunks of bacon and the most succulent fried oysters I've ever eaten sit atop this lettuce, and they don't skimp.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Mussels and frietes
                                                                                                            I think this was like, 2 pounds of mussels in the best broth I've ever had. The fries were good but I enjoyed dunking the crusty bread that came with the salad and the waitress happily brought more. I think the kitchen staff was sort of amazed watching me eat ALL of this, and I am still not quite sure how I did it either. But I really like mussels.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            The Lüke Burger
                                                                                                            This thing was huge, the bacon on it was amazing, and husband enjoyed finishing it back at the townhouse as a latenight snack.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            The service here was amazing. Our waitress was so friendly, patient and answered all our questions thoroughly. We could see the amazing efficiency and care in the kitchen, and the sommelier visited with tables and made suggestions clearly loves his job. It was a very lovely meal, and even without the gift card, would have been worth every penny -- though honestly I think this is a very affordable and accessible dining experience even for those who don't think they like fine dining. I think it's no accident Lüke is located in the financial district. I am sure they get lots of business people in there for lunch and dinner.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            This will definitely remain one of the most memorable meals of our honeymoon in New Orleans, and I hope to go back someday!

I decided to give this place a try because it's very close to my house. Tom is awesome. I brought my car in to have a look over due to my mileage a creeping over 125,000 and a slow oil leak. I left my car and within a few hours Tom called to discuss a list of items to review. He broke it down into options for me listing what he would do today if it was his car, what I had time to do but should start thinking about doing in the next 6-12 months with pricing. Tom knew what I wanted before I could even ask for it.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Because of my great experience I took my car back for the second time because I had a light pop on. Tom told me to come after work. This was a Friday night and he stayed late to work with me. He did some research on the light and even called my dealership to press the issue of why they weren't covering a replacement for possible faulty sensor light they fixed due to a recall a few months earlier.  Tom treats you like a good friend the moment you walk in his door.

Just bought a great little house in the Northern LIberties.. only problem was we realized we couldn't fit our queen boxspring up the steps. Vic not only had a brand new split queen box spring, but for an extra few bucks he brought it to us himself. He was on time and friendly, I'd recommend him for any bed-related needs!
The food is amazing. It is worth the wait. Eat here!!!! Lisa is the true hero! She is a kind soul. The wait time is confusing, so stick around. You won't regret it. Also they have city wide.

Oh and by the way, the new plumber I hired has already completed the job, it was done thursday actually which is 2 days after i called him and it was a 2 day job, that did not in fact involve ripping up my floor!  Everything is running wonderfully now that I have a competent and professional plumber.

Visited for dinner on a very busy Thursday evening and didn't have to wait for a table. The place was uncomfortably warm and very loud.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            We started off with a small dinner salad which had cranberries, fresh mozzarella, different leaves of lettuce, pinenuts, and a very tasty vinaigrette. The portion was good but the price  of the salad, $9 ,was a bit pricey.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            I had the tavern burger with cheddar cheese and grilled onions.  The burger came with fries. I must admit it was one of the tastiest burgers I've ever had. It was cooked fresh and it was very juicy.  The french fries were cooked crispy and they were seasoned perfectly. A very tasty meal indeed.
                                                                                                            My wife ordered the turkey BLT which came with sweet potato chips. She was very pleased with her meal and the sweet potato chips were really tasty.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Service was friendly and good.

Best sushi in town! The sushi masters are super friendly and talk to you at the sushi bar. The Nashville roll, Sunny roll, and spicy tuna roll still have me thinking about them the morning after. The outside may not be inviting but inside it's nice. Don't miss this place if you love sushi.

Just tried this place last night after a dance class, it was good and the workers were so kind! Thank you to Gianna for being patient and super friendly with all of our question about the menu. She was sweet and friendly. I wish they had a location in South Jersey but I would definitely go back when I'm in Philly again. Give the arugula taco salad a try and the kale lemonade! I'm not vegan or vegetarian yet, but choices like this menu persuade me to transition haha
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Oh, I forgot to mention, the salad comes with tortilla strips. I like greenery, but some may wish to ask for extra strips as they are not whole chips but rather strips. It was still enough IMO and made it crispy!!

This once cool place is now an awful hole, the food is limited and doesn't match their menu...and they are so rude about it you need to take a Xanax to clam down enough to deal with the manager. This place deserves to go out of business and don't worry about the employees, they didn't really want a job in the first place...and it shows!

Jenny has helped a scared new fur mommy be right at ease. I was heading out of town on a holiday weekend on a race and had only rescued my Malshi just recently. I was nervous and full of trepidation. She asked all the right questions, provided paperwork for me to read and sign about his care and her business, and even had me bring him buy to meet her.
                                                                                                            She was willing to adapt to my schedule and was very reasonable with pricing. She sent me photos by day, assured me he was doing well, and even bathed him since he was running and playing and had gotten dirty. I was extremely impressed by her care of him and her ability to help us both feel at ease. She welcomed him into her dog family and helped him have a great stay twice  now. I enjoy the personal service and the lack of a whole mess of dogs where he would get lost. She is incredibly patient with my boy who is very protective of me, and was very understanding. I am so thankful to have found her!

i went a few years back and i ordered the wonton noodle soup and the shrimp w/ scrambled egg over rice, the food was really good but the service was slow, they had a packed house but they were nice......i would recommend and go back to this place again if iam ever up in Reno

Brunch here was unforgettable. And I say unforgettable because I went here approximately 10 months ago, and I just got around to writing my review, and I still remember exactly what I got.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            I got The Stack, but with turkey bacon instead of regular bacon. I prefer bacon of the turkey persuasion wherever applicable. And it was great. Nay, it was PERFECT.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            I went with two other people, and it is a pretty tiny place, so seating was a little tricky on a Saturday at 11 a.m. for three people. We had to wait a while for a table, and our stomachs were eating themselves about 15 minutes into our wait, but it was worth it.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Service was a little slow, but it was pretty busy. My only real complaint is that I didn't have more room in my stomach to order more. Yes, that's my ONLY REAL COMPLAINT.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            That's really all I have for now. Please go here.
Best lobster roll in town! Get there early or order at the window outside.  Yummy
Go back do the dragons den!! This boston pizza should be revamped. Overcooked food, dirty and discussing.

Carried-out breakfast on a rainy morning. Boughnuts were simply amazing, as was the cinnamon roll! Egg biscuit was good - however, I prefer smaller/less dense biscuits. Would try another breakfast item next time - or simply order more Boughnuts!

Con: it took 4 days for them to finish the work on my jeep. When I tried to pick it up it got the run around about them not being able to find my keys. Finally went down there because no one would call me back. The keys were easily found.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Con: I took it in for 2 issues.  Only one was repaired so I had to leave it again for a couple days. No big deal, but for my troubles I requested a detailing and cleaning and this was arranged.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Con: I was dealing with Daniel in the service dept. and he texted me to let me know that my jeep was "ready to go you can pick it up today or tmrw all nice and cleaned up!" however upon arrival I found that my jeep had not been detailed or even washed. And Daniel explained that what his text should have said was "your jeep is ready, you can take it today. Or tmrw when it's all nice and cleaned up". I explained the grammatical differences between the two sentences and that punctuation actually changes the meaning of them.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            I was then told that I could leave it there again for them to clean it.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            I declined and will have it detailed at the next oil change.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Con: It does not seem like there is a lot of communication here and it's pretty frustrating to have to make several trips across town only to find that the work that was supposed to be done wasn't.... Twice.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Pro: Initially Missed my appointment and was able to reschedule the next day and still able to get the loaner I was promised.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Pro: issues were resolved.

Reasonably priced Tex/Mex food. The beer came in a frosty mug which was a nice touch and super refreshing! We both liked our meals and the portions were very large. The chips were warm and we were told when seated that they were in the process of making more. The chips and salsa was particularly good and fresh. The flavors really stood out in the carne asada. Big robust flavor as my husband put it, lol. We enjoyed our meal and would frequent Carmelita's again in the future!

We stopped in after a 12 hour night shift around 7:30am....there was a zero wait time.  When we left around 8:30am,  there was a line out the door and around the street.  My advice is to get there early! I had the Santa Fe Pancakes which were very unique,  and surprisingly good if you're up for something different.  The rest of the food was just like any other breakfast place.  Can't rave about it, but also can't complain.  Service was on point.  Atmosphere was a little loud,  but that doesn't bother me.  Large menu with lots of options, prices fair. Overall,  nice place.
Great food great pIzza. Ask for Jaimee She's the best.  This place is a must for pizza lovers

Great place for lunch!
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            It's been many years since my last experience at Bistro St Tropez, so was happy to try it out again for a business lunch.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            While the menu is a tad boring, the dishes were anything but. The salads are bright and crisp, the soups delectable and the ingredients fresh and well presented.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            Vegetarians and vegans could get by there, but have to great a little creative. Nothing on the lunch menu is specifically vegetarian.

They're back! I was so excited to hear that the original owners of Sk Noodle were back and opening up a new restaurant.  I have been a long time customer of theirs... and as soon as I walked in she immediately recognized me and gave me a huge hug!  I was so pleased! !! So as usual I sit down, the place has been totally revamped  and brightened up from the dark Thai restaurant it once was. The tables and Chairs are classic and clean. The ambiance is perfect for casual lunch/dinner dates . I ordered the spring rolls to start.... delicious and I love that they use dark green lettuce instead of iceberg which some  places do alot of here in Reno. Then came the #4. Rare beef and flank. I was craving Pho all week so this hit the spot. Their broth was delicious and fresh, the flank didn't have sooooo much fat on it that you couldn't eat it. It was tender amd almost fell apart in your mouth. All in all I was very pleased and satisfied with my visit to their new restaurant.  I will definitely be back!  Oh Also I saw the lunch menu..... a must check out and try!!!!!!

This is one of the best WaWas. It's spacious, the lines move quickly, and there is room to stand to wait for your sandwich or even sit down to eat it.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            This location does still suffer from WaWas biggest problem. The biggest problem is that they bake their own hoagie rolls in store instead of buying rolls from Amoroso. Amoroso rolls were perfect. The rolls baked in store do not compare even when cooked perfectly. But many times the rolls are overcooked making them even worse. The hoagies are still good, but you can get better ones elsewhere close by and there was a time when you couldn't say that, especially about the tuna hoagie.

Good Asian Food
                                                                                                            I have eaten there many times for lunch and dinner. They have a really good menu and prepare the food well. For the most part, the service is good but I have been there when we had to wait a long time to place our order and a long time to have it served. No the place was not packed. Most times the wait staff is really good and they know the menu. My wife has a pretty bad shellfish allergy which we bring to their attention. Usually, they make sure her meal is not contaminated and that is much appreciated. However, the last two times we were there she had a problem. The result we stopped going. We found CHI at the Peppermill which was an excellent replacement.
Good spot to see a game or concert. Lots of parking. Prices for parking and grub are typical for entertainment facilities. Good sight lines.

We need to clarify the rating the food was 5 star but the service was 2. There is no wait staff. We were table of 5 3 rice bowls , lamb sliders, and charcuterie board. Very tight space with cool vibe. One of the owners runs the door but needs to serve tables instead. The food and music were both great. No service prolly means no return business from me. We went a few doors down to bamboulas while waiting for our table and should have stayed there the music was good and service was way better.

I don't even want to give this place 1 star, but I have to in order to place this review.  This place is absolutely terrible. The host/hostess are so unprofessional and miserable. We first got seated after about 15 minutes of no one paying us any attention, then to get seated and never have a server come over. I had to get up to go find a server. We then had to wait about 20 minutes before we got our drinks.  The food was absolutely terrible. It was barely cooked and had no flavor.  We then went up to the patio bar after we ate to again wait another 20 minutes before someone even approached us. (And this is after making complete full on eye contact numerous times). The bartender was so rude and ignorant (her name is Tiffany). I have never in my life experienced what I experienced at this place this past weekend. Every single person that works there is so cocky, ignorant and rude.  It's so unbelievable. Asked for a manger as well, and they never came over to us to hear our complaints. Will NEVER be going back there.

The only reason I am giving it to stars is because it is closer to my house than the other Walmarts. So it is a convenient location. But that's about it on the plus side. The parking lot is horrible. There is just not enough parking for a Walmart in that area. Tarpon Springs is a great place, but this store brings out the scum of the surrounding areas. I don't feel safe if I have to make a Walmart run after 9pm. Besides a select few cashiers that are really nice, there is no assistance at all. The site to store pickup is horrible. I sat there 25 minutes before I had to demand another employee (who was just standing there behind the desk playing on his telxon) to radio the site to store person to get my order. That employee who was just standing behind the desk doesn't do much of anything whenever I'm in there, and I can't figure out what he does. I don't even think he knows what his job is, but it's clearly not helping customers. What finally pushed me over the edge to write this review was that I bought some meat yesterday and unfortunately I forgot to look at the expiration date which was that day. This upsets me because this is not the first, second, third, or fourth time this has happened at this store with food items. Now I have to inconveniently go back and exchange the meat. I think it's now worth driving to the Trinity location since I've never had a problem there.

Comfortable bed, good breakfast, fast internet, great location, and low price. Overall I was really impressed with this place. However, if you stay on the top floors you may be waiting up to 15 minutes for an elevator in the morning.

Spend your $$$ elsewhere. I took my family to Bennihanna's in Plymouth Meeting for my wife's birthday. The food is overpriced (they charged me $2.60 for a child's milk), the service is slow and inattentive, and the chef was inexperienced and not entertaining.  Normally I overlook these issues, but when a restaurant charges $30 - $40 for an entree, I expect an exceptional dinning experience on par with a Sullivan's, Morton's, or Capital Grille.  Bennihanna's was anything but exceptional, and to cap it off the manager solicits your address and email information at the end of the meal.  Totally cheesy!  In the Plymouth Meeting/King of Prussia area there are about 10 hibachi restaurants (all less expensive than Bennihanna), so there is no lack of competition.  I wouldn't be surprised to see this Bennihanna location out of business within the next 12 months.  They will get the movie crowd from the neighboring AMC, but I can't imagine them getting any repeat business.

Dr. Berg was very friendly and helpful. Left pain free and happy. The office was really clean and staff was friendly. I really enjoyed that we were able to get in the same day we called made it so nice to not have to wait to get an appointment

I've been here before and I've  had good experiences.  Today I decided to bring a friend here for the first time thinking I'd get the same experience. I was wrong. To start its Sunday and I guess the game takes precedence over any customer. The hostess tried to seat me and my friend in a sad corner away from anyone else as if we were diseased or something but seated us at a table only after I expressed my feeling about being seated away. The server while friendly forgot my friends order and brought his order late. We had made it known right up front we weren't here to see football but it seems we should have as other customers were recently being helped more than us. It seems ridiculous that we got handed a happy hour menu only to be told there's no happy hour because of the game. I'm so embarrassed that I brought my friend here after I told him this was a cool spot to hang out at. This is the last time I set foot here. Just plain awful experience.
Great service, nice staff and bar tenders, good bar food, and inexpensive beer. What more do you need?

Fast friendly and knowledgable. I needed some parts for my Toyota 4Runner. I called and the man on the phone was professional. I explained to him what I needed and he helped me get the correct parts and some parts I didn't know I was going to have to use. The price is more than your Auto-Zone, but you get the OEM Parts, they fit correctly and were designed for your specific application.

Not sanotary they use alot of the salad ingredients from the pizza line which is touched without gloves.management is horrible. No refunds just empty credits. I feel bad for staff that gets yelled at infront of custoners for things they didnt do especially when ive come in and seen it first hand . soda is always out. Never stocked. Floors r filthy. Dough is not fresh at all. Its mostly almost frozen then quickly defrosted. Cross contamination. 100%  food safety precautions are not takrn what so ever. Ceo of marcos needs to look deeply into this store and see hpw the stores owner treats employees and ex employees. Ignorong them refusing to serve them or communicate without a ban notice. Its sad.

I went to Revolucion last night for the first time, but only for drinks.  I'll update my review when I have a chance to go there for food.  It has a fun, colorful atmosphere inside.  You can spend several minutes just checking out the arrangements of Mexican wrestling masks, action figures, and sombreros of many colors, along with the bold artwork.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            I had the chili margarita, which was pretty much a regular margarita with chili powder on the rim and a thai red chili floating in the drink.  Only $5.50, which isn't bad.  The taste was different, but good.  (I did wake up with terrible heartburn in the early hours of the morning, but that may have been unrelated ;)
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            The menu looked quite tasty, and I can't wait to go back to try the tacos  I also hear the beer selection is good.  If they are as good as I imagine, it may raise my rating to a 5 next time!
The only gym I have ever belonged to that is not so packed during peak hours that I can actually work out during peak hours.

Do not waste your time waiting in line for a restaurant that is a shade of its former self. The pancakes are rock hard and lack flavor. I remember being an undergraduate in Nashville in the late 1990's and I always loved going to Pancake Pantry. Sadly, the length of the wait line is the only aspect of this restaurant that remains. Try Biscuit Love's Hillsboro Village location instead.

Family Fence Company installed a tan vinyl fence at one of my properties in August, and they did a fantastic job.  Everything was handled very promptly and professionally.  The job was done in one day, and came out even better than we expected.

okay, it's official: this is seriously the most overrated place in the neighborhood, and possibly in the city.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            i visited again for breakfast, and again for dinner, just to be sure.  i visited a couple nearby brunch competitors, to compare.  breakfast dishes are average, and dinner dishes are downright awful.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            dinner visit: i had crabcakes to start, and the veggie chili frito pie.  the crabcakes could not have possibly been made with fresh crab.  no flavor and the texture was not good.  not jumbo lump meat, either, which was another disappointment.  i'm a native marylander... i know crabcakes.  the chili in the frito pie was actually terrible.  i don't know how one can possibly go wrong with chili; i make veggie chili at home all the time and it's one of the world's simplest things to make taste good.  this was not good. i removed the cheese layer, pushed the chili aside, and munched on a couple fritos for dinner.  my friends' food did not fare much better, and they are some of the biggest honey's fans around, sharing the same block with them and all.  the meat chili was apparently about as bland as my veggie chili.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            brunch, on another occasion, was nothing to complain about, but nothing special either.  french toast and coffee.  average.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            the staff is very friendly and decor's cute.  i'll give it that.  but waiting in those crazy weekend brunch lines i guess will be something i'll never get.

This place is a must for breakfast if you find yourself in Nashville. Yes, there's a line but it moves - rather quickly - so don't get discouraged if you see a long line out the door.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            My mom and I showed up at 9:00 am on a Saturday and waited ten minutes, tops. The place is decent sized inside, not too big and not too small. The wait staff moves quite swiftly, they're getting you in and out.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            We started off with coffee. If it's how you like your coffee, be sure to ask for half and half because they supply milk on the table. I kept it simple and ordered a half order (3) of their buttermilk pancakes. Note: you can half any order of pancakes. My mom got the bacon eggs and subbed out the pancakes for the hashbrowns. The hashbrowns were excellent, crispy and hot!
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            They sell their own merch so feel free to pick up a t-shirt or mug on your way out. We both really enjoyed our meals and wish we could've visited this place more than once during our stay.
I think that everybody in our group was for the most part satisfied but this definitely isn't anything spectacular. They did have live music but it was pretty packed and hard to maneuver around.

I brought my son here for glass fusing, since pottery painting is for girls! The staff was not too helpful in explaining the process, or showing us where the bins of tools were or telling us that we had to "glue" our pieces on as we go. If you don't know what your doing, you will end up setting up your glass pieces twice like we did... The positives - the selection of pre-cut glass was abundant and there was no one else at the table so we had lots of room! They have gloves available so children don't cut their hands.
                                                                                                            
                                                                                                            When I picked up our pieces, some clay had dropped onto my glass plate so it didn't have a smooth finish and the foiled glass 'puckered" making it look odd. The cost for two small squares of glass and the sitting fee was $48. If we would have had help in the beginning (and not had to ask for help three times) and my piece hadn't been damaged by someone elses clay project, this would have been five-star glass fusing fun!

So glad that I stopped in here while strolling around Lambertville Sat. afternoon!
